page.title: 19Traction Engine Rally
page.content: In 1966 a Traction Engine Rally was held in Camerton in order to raise funds to renovate{St. Peter's church. The rally was successful and generated much interest so it was to be repeated annually over the next 14 years, the last being held in 1980. Sufficient{funds}were raised to redecorate inside the church and carpet throughout. The very long drive was relaid and the bells re-smelted. Three local men, the brothers Goold and Mr. Cleeves who had purchased an engine at the time of the first rally still restore and renovate them today.
